Package io.anserini.index

Class IndexReaderUtils

java.lang.Object
io.anserini.index.IndexReaderUtils
public class IndexReaderUtils
extends java.lang.Object
Class containing a bunch of static helper methods for accessing a Lucene inverted index. This class provides a lot of functionality that is exposed in Python via Pyserini.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • analyzeTerm

      public static java.lang.String analyzeTerm​(java.lang.String term)
      Feeds a term through the EnglishStemmingAnalyzer and returns the stemmed form. If the input is a multi-token string, returns the first token.
      Parameters:
      term - term
      Returns:
      stemmed form of the term or null if error encountered

    • analyzeTermWithAnalyzer

      public static java.lang.String analyzeTermWithAnalyzer​(java.lang.String term, org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer analyzer)
      Feeds a term through an analyzer and returns the stemmed form. If the input is a multi-token string, returns the first token.
      Parameters:
      term - term
      analyzer - analyzer to use
      Returns:
      stemmed form of the term or null if error encountered

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Long> getDocumentVector​(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader, java.lang.String docid) throws java.io.IOException, NotStoredException
      Returns the document vector for a particular document as a map of terms to term frequencies.
      Parameters:
      reader - index reader
      docid - collection docid
      Returns:
      the document vector for a particular document as a map of terms to term frequencies
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if error encountered during query
      NotStoredException - if the term vector is not stored

      Parameters:

      docid - collection docid

      Returns:
      BM25 weight of the term in the specified document
